body: @rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests

This one is only a description change. It does not require integration tests to be run. The smoke tests executed by Travis already passed. 

I will proceed merging this one latter if no objects.
It would be helpful for SG rules too for example, for IP aliases, snapshots...

What do you mean? Add the same thing to those rules/configurations?
Well, that is interesting but it is not a requirement in our side for now. Maybe in the future.

Yeah, it wasn't aimed to this PR, more as a general idea.

I'm ok with this change. If you think `description` is better than `reason` and you're willing to modify your PR, let us know otherwise we'll merge it.
I am still thinking about the change you mentioned. As soon as I have some feedback I tell you guys.

@DaanHoogland I managed to separate the formatting from the code change itself. Now it should be easier to review.

@khos2ow, @marcaurele and others, this might be of your interest as well (if you run XenServer).

I am going to leave it as is. If we change the "reason" field name, I would need to change all references (JS, CSS, and labels) to make a more concise change. Maybe, if we feel that description is better, I can change that in the near future with another PR.

@houthuis @rafaelweingartner I am fine with this.
I will merge then. Thanks @DaanHoogland, @borisroman and @houthuis
@Slair1 @rafaelweingartner , can you come to agreement (maybe Rafael's sugestion here or in a separate PR?)
@rafaelweingartner sorry for sickness and â‚¬dayjob preventing me to review again, can you resolve conflicts?
It is ok the code as is. However, it might have been interesting to see the feedback of the author.
@borisstoyanov it might be failing because the last packaging happened long time ago and some part of the PR has been changed since then. We might need to do the BO package once again.

@rafaelweingartner I will. The reason for it's not done yet was that we wanted to partially upgrade Xen cluster and do one round of functional test and then fully upgrade the cluster and then re-run iperf tests.
nice find, dirty hack, though maybe justified. Isn't the proper solution to put both queries in a transaction, @marcaurele ?
@DaanHoogland done.
LGTM , Thanks guys for the work.

Yea, i can work to modularize this, i unfortunately don't have the time at the moment, but can later.

On the tests, do you mean Unit Tests?  I've never wrote a unit test before, but agree it would be good to have
Since this is the same as #2429, should we just back-merge that?
I've never created a Marvin Test before, but can look at test_vm_life_cycle.py to try and figure it out

@wido My opinion is that the ability to start a VM on two hosts in the cluster is a bigger issue.  We run KVM and just enabled libvirt's lockd to stop that from being able to happen.  Maybe this PR could be changed to be an option, just reboot host or stop agent.

https://libvirt.org/locking-lockd.html

I actually meant unit tests. I think they would fit better the method extraction. They would also be easier to develop. Once you get to create them, if you are unsure how to proceed, just ping me. I can help you.

A new template will need to be created to test this PR, the only issue it could cause are page/memory thrashing (page-swaps) for redundant routers as that's the only VR type that almost ends up consuming all the RAM (tested/seen in kvm and vmware). @resmo can you provide some test results, such as RAM consumption for VPC or isolated RVRs on vmware etc?

Can we merge, or do we need CI?
All changes are in either Simulator, or our marvin tests,
so technically, running smoke isn't impacted.

Ok, thanks.
I had a problem with these changes and XenServer 6.5. XS 6.5 is using TLSV1.

I'll wait on your response and kick the smoketests.

I added unit test for the code I changed. I was not planning to create a Marvin tests though.
If you guys think it is a requirement, I can look into it.

Well, now, errors changed. I am not sure if this is a good sign though.

Trillian test result (tid-2361) Environment: xenserver-65sp1 (x2), Advanced Networking with Mgmt server 7 Total time taken: 22912 seconds Marvin logs: https://github.com/blueorangutan/acs-prs/releases/download/trillian/pr2376-t2361-xenserver-65sp1.zip Smoke tests completed. 67 look OK, 0 have error(s) Only failed tests results shown below: Test | Result | Time (s) | Test File --- | --- | --- | ---
@rafaelweingartner with xs 6.5sp1, latest 4.11 has no errors. LGTM, what errors if any are you seeing wrt the TLS fix (with latest 4.11)?

I see, you are using the SP1. The error was that we were trying to use API (ACS connecting to the XenServer host), but it uses HTTPS via TLS1, and we wanted 1.2. The server was configured to work only with version 1, which will be no longer supported by ACS.

@rafaelweingartner how different is your XenServer host from a usually installed default setup (do you have to seed/setup https certificates?). I'll ask @PaulAngus or @DagSonstebo either of whom may advise us if the Trillian based tests uses HTTPS enabled XenServer hosts (default or custom cert setup).

It is pretty standard. I did not installed any SP. It is the 6.5 version you get when you install XenServer using the ISO provided by Citrix. No, I did not setup certificates. I tried to look for a way to change the protocol used for securing the XS API, but I only found a way to do that on XS 7.

I asked you because I was a little worried that this could break things in production. Therefore, it might be interesting to release a warning or some extra instructions for the upgrade.

In that case, the XenServer 6.5sp1 setup we've for trillian based testing is default installed xenserver from iso. @PaulAngus can you comment on this, do you think it could break TLS or is there any workaorund for @rafaelweingartner? If it indeed break things in production, we can introduce a global settings or config/file based approach to fixing this (enable/disable a set of tls versions).

@DaanHoogland thank you very much!

We will finally push this PR forward.

@Slair1 I have no easy way to put this. You have four (4) PRs out and all fail all travis runs. It must be that travis doesn't like your github handle, or so. Can you think of something you have/do that might cause this. In the same period other PRs have passed travis runs...?
